content.rendered:
Getting Started

  • About — A few notes about what this site is all about.
  • Good reads — Books about aerospace & engineering that I have read, and that I highly recommend to visitors of this blog.
  • Newsletter — Each month I send out a digest of the newest posts on this blog, interesting book recommendations, and other cool aerospace related articles, pictures and videos that I found across the internet.
  • Podcast — Conversations with aerospace pioneers that are working at the cutting-edge of aerospace design and research.
  • Contact — If you want to contact me on Twitter, Linkedin or read some of my research articles.

Series

See below a selection of articles I have published on specific topics. Feel free to read them in order or jump between articles. Each of these series will provide an interesting perspective on a specific topic in aerospace engineering.

Rocket Science
  1. A History of Rocket Science
  2. Operating Principles of Rockets
  3. Fuels, Engine and Nozzle Design
  4. Supersonics and Nozzles
  5. Lightweight Rocket Shells
Jet Engines
  1. The Birth of the Jet Engine
  2. Jet Engine Design and Optimisation
  3. The Compressor
  4. The Turbine
  5. Turbine Cooling
  6. Thrust Reversal
  7. The Scramjet
  8. Afterburning
Composite Materials
  1. An Introduction to Composites
  2. Composites Manufacturing and Autoclave Manufacturing
  3. Sandwich Panels
  4. Composites and Wind Turbines
  5. Non-destructive Testing of Composites
  6. Variable Stiffness Composites
  7. Developments in Composites
Aircraft Design
  1. Evolution of Airplanes
  2. Antifragile Aircraft Design
  3. From Gliders to WWII Fighters
  4. Complexity, Risk and Failure
  5. Why Are Aircraft Not Made of Glass?
Aircraft Structures
  1. A Brief History of Aircraft Structures
  2. Loads Acting on Aircraft
  3. Milestones in Structural Design
  4. The De-Havilland Comet Crash
  5. The Mystery of Wing Twisting
Boundary Layers and Aerodynamic Design
  1. On Boundary Layers
  2. Boundary Layer Separation
  3. What Creates Lift?
  4. The Navier-Stokes Equation
  5. Wind-Tunnel Testing
  6. Aeroelasticity
Human Fallibility
  1. An Introduction
  2. A Case Study

Random Goodies

Not about a specific topic, and not particularly technical. Basically me having fun with different topics related to aerospace engineering:

  • The Fluid Mechanics of Beer Bubbles
  • Engineering – A Manifesto
  • What Makes a Good Engineer?
  • The Dangers of Outsourcing

jetpack-related-posts.title: Podcast
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: This is an exciting time to be an aerospace engineer! Scientific breakthroughs in battery technology, machine learning, 3-D printing, and materials science are changing the way we design aircraft and rockets. These technologies have ushered in a new era in aerospace engineering, which will see transformations in the way we…

jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Support the Aerospace Engineering Blog This website is a free educational resource and will always remain so. jetpack-related-posts.title: Contact
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: I am a Royal Academy of Engineering Research Fellow and Lecturer in Digital Engineering of Structures based at the Bristol Composites Institute of the University of Bristol. My research focus is on lightweight design of engineering structures using composite materials (e.g. carbon-fibre reinforced plastics) and through multi-functional design (i.e. structures…

jetpack-related-posts.title: About this Blog
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Insights into Aerospace Engineering and Aviation On December 17, 1903 the bicycle mechanic Orville Wright successfully piloted the first heavier-than-air machine, his brother Wilbur running alongside him to prevent the wing tip from touching the floor. The Wright Flyer was constructed mainly from wood and canvas with a 12 horse-power petrol…
